website_summaries.verdict: High-quality and affordable dishwasher detergent tablets that are proven to perform.
pros: Include a biodegradable and phosphate-free formula
Plant-based and mineral ingredients ensure you can wash your dirty dishes, glasses and flatware without harming the planet
Does not contain any dyes, chlorine, or fragrances
Simple to use in any dishwasher
cons: May result in water spots and tiny particles of food on dishes
Sometimes they do not fully dissolve in a dishwasher

customer_reviews.title: Ecover bought by SC Johnson in 2017
customer_reviews.text: We've used this product for many years and loved it, but unfortunately this company was purchased by SC Johnson in 2017. SC Johnson is a huge soap company- they also own Pledge and Shout - and this company uses animals to test its products. They are now instituting animal testing for Ecover (and Method as well), so be mindful that the values of Ecover have changed. This seems to be yet another one of those previously sustainable and animal-friendly companies that sold out and is now just green-washing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E. V.

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped in trash
customer_reviews.text: Who in their right mind would design an "eco" product that comes in tablet form AND THEN INDIVIDUALLY WRAP EACH TABLET IN PLASTIC GARBAGE?! I cannot understand this product. So shortsighted!
customer_reviews.author: Ilonka Zlatar

customer_reviews.title: Each tab is individually wrapped in plastic.
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine but each individual tab comes wrapped in plastic. It can be recycled but that doesn’t mean much and most of these small pieces of plastic will likely end up in the trash. This choice doesn’t align with their “planet-loving people” statement. I recommend the manufacturer revisit this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic!
customer_reviews.text: So this product works great. My dishes come out clean for the most part. Some silicone utensils I have come out with a white film but that’s easy to wipe off. The thing I really don’t like is that each tab is individually wrapped in plastic. I bought these because I was trying to be environmentally friendly and now there is so much plastic waste.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Still lots of plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, but the whole point of buying dish detergent in a cardboard box (at least for me) is to reduce the amount of plastic used. However, each of these tablets is individually wrapped in #5 plastic - not many Recycling services will take tiny little bits of plastic wrap like this. At least the bottle of liquid detergent comes in a universally-recyclable bottle. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: moose momTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Annoying that each tablet is packaged in plastic
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine. But I won't be buying it again since it defeats the whole purpose of a cardboard box and the "eco" label by packaging each individual tablet in a plastic that many recycling streams don't process. I'm looking for something closer to zero waste, where I can compost or recycle the box and have no plastic leftover.
customer_reviews.author: brooklyncakes

customer_reviews.title: Super bummed to get these "eco" friendly dishwasher tablets to ...
customer_reviews.text: Super bummed to get these "eco" friendly dishwasher tablets to discover they are all individually wrapped in plastic. You have to unwrap each one and put it in the washer. And, if you're doing dishes and your hands are wet, they are incredibly hard to unwrap. :(
customer_reviews.author: Gardener Girl

customer_reviews.title: Eco product? EACH POD WRAPPED IN PLASTIC
customer_reviews.text: 1 Star because these work fine. But minus 4 stars due to false advertising. The ‘eco’ stance is a total marketing ploy. Each individual pod is wrapped in plastic. So they tout an environmentally friendly product when every pod contributes polluting plastic wrap into a landfill/soil/waterways. These tiny plastic wrappers are not recyclable. No reason for pods to be individually wrapped. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Removed hard water stains caused by my last phosphate free ...
customer_reviews.text: Removed hard water stains caused by my last phosphate free dish detergent!! Always found that to be an issue with dish detergent made without phosphates. I'm lazy and sometimes forgot to rinse my dishes but ecover let's me be the lazy slob I was born to be and still cleans my dishes! Check pictures for comparison! Left cup washed with ecover and right cup washed with my old detergent, it's night and day difference.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: normal dishwasher, really bad for the environment, the "eco" from the brand is bs
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, but the whole point of buying dish detergent in a cardboard box (at least for me) is to reduce the amount of plastic used. However, each of these tablets is individually wrapped in plastic. never again
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to use more eco friendly cleaners, and thought they might work well based upon reviews (NOPE). These tablets are individually wrapped first off, so it's a pain to use them and lots of packaging waste. They also frequently left white grit on my glasses. They otherwise cleaned all right. I have switched back to Grab Green, which always cleans clear and smells fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Betty W

customer_reviews.title: All of this wasted plastic negates the point of being eco-friendly
customer_reviews.text: These tablets are each individually wrapped in a layer of plastic that must be removed before using. All of this wasted plastic negates the point of being eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Blatant green washing, not actually eco-friendly at all
customer_reviews.text: Tablets work really nicely, I didn't have any problem with dissolving, residue, aftertaste, etc. BUT, the whole point of ordering these for me was the idea that they are supposed to be eco-friendly. Yet every tablet is individually wrapped in plastic? They make the claim that it's recyclable but newsflash, the Chinese are not buying our plastic to recycle anymore and there are very few recycling facilities in the US, so all that plastic is going to sit in a warehouse or just go straight into landfills or worse, the ocean. Try dropps instead, people.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Will clog your dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: These do not dissolve well and will build up on the nozzles of your dishwasher. Often the tablet would be still mostly formed after running the dishwasher. If you're looking for something natural and eco friendly that actually cleans your dishes, I recommend:  We started using them when we were giving bottles to our daughter to get rid of milk residue. We no longer need them for that, but have continued to use them and will keep using them since they just work so well on regular dishes too.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sahni

customer_reviews.title: Work well and leave no residual scent
customer_reviews.text: I Ordered these because I was starting to feel uncomfortable with the amount of soap scent That was left behind on my dishes from traditional popular brand dishwasher packs. My kids sippy cups would smell strongly of soap even with additional rinsing and I hated them drinking from that. I decided to try these as they are more natural. So far they are working great. We've run several loads. Dishes have all come clean and there's no scent left behind. I'm happy to pay a bit more for these tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Cmonkey

customer_reviews.title: They did a great job!
customer_reviews.text: These did a real good job! As you can see the glasses are clear and I didn't even have jet dry in my dishwasher. I will continue to buy these because their much cheaper than any other natural dish tabs I've found!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Grayson

customer_reviews.title: I have an excellent dishwasher and have never had problems with dishes getting ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an excellent dishwasher and have never had problems with dishes getting clean in general, but this ecover product was an unexpected and inexplicable fail. As I unloaded the "clean" dishes, I noticed they were all cloudy and tacky feeling... Seemed like it had run with no soap. But the little door was open for the soap dispenser so I knew it had operated as always. Then when I got done unloading, I found the entire ecover tablet lying in the bottom of the dishwasher, completely intact! It had not dissolved even a little. Just like a rock. Sending it back for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah in PDX

customer_reviews.title: The tablets don't dissolve in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why but these tablets don't break down. We don't have this issue with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Eickman5

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, even though the individually wrapped soap packages are recyclable, they are so small that most facilities won’t be able to recycle them. On top of that, it is #5, which a lot of communities can’t except. I like everything else about the product, but for such an responsible company just go the extra mile and fix your packaging.
customer_reviews.author: cara

customer_reviews.title: Great soap, PLASTIC wrappers 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: The tablets are handy. The detergent really gets the dishes clean! Here's why it only got 2 stars from me: Ecover says "biodegradable" and "good for the planet"while packaging these tablets in 25 PLASTIC baggies. If that isn't self-defeating irony, then IDK what is. I certainly won't be purchasing these again. Instead I'm getting the powder in a paper box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Environment and Cleans Well
customer_reviews.text: As long as I load my dishwasher properly, I've always gotten good cleaning results from using Ecover. There have been a few times where some top rack items weren't that clean, but I think they came from overloading the dishwasher. Compared to using Cascade, you don't get that chemically squeaky clean feel on your dishes, but they definitely come out clean with Ecover. I think my only gripe with these dishwasher tablets is that each one is individually wrapped in plastic. It'd be nice if they could change this to reduce the plastic waste. The big plusses: no fragrance, no weird chemicals, biodegradable, a box 94% made from recycled paper, and plant-based ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy C.

customer_reviews.title: Leaves behind a terrible taste on drinking cups and glass
customer_reviews.text: No I don't have a problem with these tablets dissolving, they dissolve just fine. No I don't have a problem with dirty film left on dishes, it cleans just fine. What I do have a problem with is the after taste it leaves on every cup and glass, its a chemical citrus taste that overpowers any tea or water I'm drinking and I can't stand it. If you're going to use Ecover tablets use Ecover Zero, at least that eliminates the awful left over taste.
customer_reviews.author: singer

customer_reviews.title: Individual wrappers don't easily tear open
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a month now, and the dishes are sparkly plus I feel virtuous for choosing an environmentally responsible brand. My issue is that the little individual wrappers are about a 50/50 odds for being easily torn open, or an active fight ending in me having to get a pair of scissors to cut them open. It's a little thing... but every time I can't just rip it open, I'm annoyed. It's a home maintenance product used once or twice a day. That's far too frequently to have to deal with bad product packaging. Sorry. Bit of a fail on the current incarnation.
customer_reviews.author: Lindley Karstens

customer_reviews.title: Warning about Silverware
customer_reviews.text: Love these being natural and not leaving smells and cleaning, BUT silverware (and I do mean actual silver) gets tarnished easily or occasionally turns dark, almost black. Then after months of using cover, my dishes have black marks on their surface, marks that don't wash off. Finally occurred to me that the black marks were probably silver loose from my silverware. I've not had this happen before with other natural brands, but they don't wash as well. Love my silver; hate hand washing it. I'll try half a tab to see if that corrects the problem. And maybe half a tab with vinegar. If anyone, a chemist?, has suggestions, I am all ears.
customer_reviews.author: Joya

customer_reviews.title: A natural one that actually works !
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE natural stuff. I do not love spending a lot and then it doesn't work. I got these after going through several types of natural ones that weren't great. OK so the tablets are wrapped individually in little plastic wrap which is not ideal but it's a lot less plastic than many others. Plus, I had one that was not wrapped from a different brand and the tablets turned into a solid block before they were halfway used. So maybe it's not ideal but it's a good compromise. These clean as well as Cascade but have the environmental benefits. I'll continue using these!
customer_reviews.author: Doe Z

customer_reviews.title: This. Stuff. Works.
customer_reviews.text: Because I always use eco-friendly products, I thought my dishwasher was just crappy. Hoping there were better products out there, I kept ordering different dishwasher detergents, ever hopeful that the new one wouldn't require me to pre-rinse, pre-soak, and sometimes even pre-scrub my dishes. I HAVE FINALLY FOUND THE ONE! This stuff works great. Dishes are clean and film-free, and no coffee or tea stains either. Like other reviewers said, the one down side is the bit of film plastic that each one is wrapped in, but fortunately, we have a film plastic recycling program so that handles that. Turns out my dishwasher ain't so bad. Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: KU and RU

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest dishes ever - not just for a clean product... but all dishwasher products i've used.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very discerning when it comes to green products.. or any product for that matter. They should work, and do a very good job. I would continue to use a green product over a non green product none the less. That said, these Ecover Tablets flat Out WORK! My dishes are the cleanest i've seen them. Glasses are spotless and crystal clear even the ones that were dingy from prior dishwasher brands. Excellent product and easy to use. I'm not only sold, I just reordered.
customer_reviews.author: tobin strickland

customer_reviews.title: Effective detergent, no streaks or residue
customer_reviews.text: First wash, 6/30/2020. As you can see from the pictures, no streaks or residue. I’m surprised at how effective this detergent turned out given that I have a pretty old dishwasher. No odor or detectable fragrance, but thats fine with me. It is unfortunate that each pod is individually wrapped, but I guess you can’t have it all. It’s either that or receive a box leaking white powder - which as you might imagine, not the safest thing when going through a logistics chain.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Film on dishes that I could feel and didn't dissolve all the way.
customer_reviews.text: This did not dissolve all the way. Dishes felt a bit not all the way clean. Maybe the scent free version would be better, but I did not like this one. The other issue is that they are all individually wrapped so you are throwing away plastic each time. All dish pods you have to dry your hands to put them in the dishwasher. I have tried Seventh Generation, which I like. Not sure if there is a suspect ingredient in it though. The 365 brand from Whole Foods does have pods that you do not need to unwrap if you are looking for an alternative. They also sell this product there.
customer_reviews.author: J. Daigneault

customer_reviews.title: Went out on a limb and bought the 6 pack....but very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this 6 pack without knowing if I'd like it. Its great! it has fewer concerning ingredients than the Presto brand, and is a better price than the Seventh Generation. Also the tablets work great in our Bosch. I'll keep buying this for awhile (if I ever run out hah!).
customer_reviews.author: calicycler

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Greenwashing!
customer_reviews.text: These supposedly eco-friendly dishwasher tablets come individually wrapped in “recyclable” plastic wrappers. Small pieces of plastic like this are usually not accepted in curbside recycling programs due to the fact that they clog mechanical sorting systems or get sorted into other material streams, causing entire batches of perfectly recyclable material to be diverted to landfills. These are the kinds of things that end up in waterways, choking wildlife. A product claiming to be green should be minimally packaged with truly recyclable materials.
customer_reviews.author: FinPDX

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a powder like residue on dishes, doesn’t do the job.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all! I’m super disappointed with this product. I decided on this after reading reviews about a multitude of natural cleaning products but this leaves residue that feels like the powder itself on dishes. Will return if possible. Needed something that I’m comfortable with washing baby bottles too but definitely not working as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: N K

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually more of a standard grocery store dishwasher liquid kind of person, so this was my first time using dishwasher tablets, let alone an "eco-friendly" kind. Like many of the other reviews mentioned, I was a bit surprised that an eco-friendly brand wraps each tablet in plastic; however, the box does say that the plastic is recyclable, so I'm recycling it. Honestly, I only bought these because there weren't any other kinds of dishwasher detergent available at the time, so eco-friendliness wasn't my priority. I just wanted something that will clean my dishes effectively. I was happily surprised that it works just as well as my usual dishwasher liquid!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Glasses come out clear
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This is the only Product I use in the dishwasher, I don’t need water softener or rinse aid and glasses come out clear. Make sure you rinse out your dishwasher filter basket (at the bottom of the tub) regularly to keep everything clean and clear. I wish it didn’t have individual plastic wrappers for each tablet.
customer_reviews.author: tdata

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but don't love the wrappers
customer_reviews.text: These tabs work really well. My dishes are clean and without residue after every wash. That being said, one reason I bought these is because they are eco-friendly; however, each tab is wrapped in plastic. Luckily, in our neighborhood we can recycle this kind of plastic, but the last city I lived in didn't recycle plastic bags and other thin plastic like these wrappers. I wish these came in tabs without the plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great hard water tabs. Yes, plastic wrapper.
customer_reviews.text: Yep. This works perfectly with harder water. We have found these kinds of natural tabs work best. The last brand we loved changed somehow and quit working as well. Switched to this and everything's perfect again. We only use white vinegar as our rinse aid. Also run a citric acid powder wash with a load twice a month to descale. Plastic packaging tussle: yes. Each is wrapped. But having used these types of tabs in the past, they dissolve very easily. I almost always have my dish gloves on so while I don't enjoy the plastic environmentally, I do practically.
customer_reviews.author: T. Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: They work and I keep buying them. some people are concerned because they're individually wrapped That's keep them from disintegrating from moisture in the air between the time you get them and use them again It keeps them dry and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: ROBBIN

customer_reviews.title: Worst tabs I’ve used, ever.
customer_reviews.text: I’m shocked by the positive reviews this product has, because these suck! I’ve been using them for the past few weeks and have been disappointed ever since. They simply do not clean. I included pictures of 3 glasses, all had dirt and grime stuck to them after the wash(all 9 glasses in this wash were still dirty after the wash). This is a normal occurrence with glasses and mugs with this product, it can’t clean them. Trust me, don’t buy this! It doesn’t clean glass! Doesn’t clean baked on goods! Doesn’t get grease off of pans! What’s the point?
customer_reviews.author: Chris94

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does the job! Replaced my everyday dishwasher tabs for safer.
customer_reviews.text: I recently did a complete "safer" overhaul of SO many products that we use in our household for everyday things. These come individually packaged, around the same size as any normal dishwasher tablets. They dissolve well & seem to clean as adequately as store bought did. There isn't any smell/residue leftover either. Please note, they do not alone leave your dishes sparkly clean!! I would definitely recommend purchasing a Rinse Aid as well to use with them.
customer_reviews.author: 13huntress

customer_reviews.title: Dishwasher Repairman told us to throw away!
customer_reviews.text: After using this product, we noticed our stainless steel Bosch dishwasher was emitting a foul smell and our “clean” glasses produced soap bubbles when filled with water, indicating they were not fully rinsed. We had a very reputable dishwasher repairman come inspect the dishwasher, thinking it wasn’t draining properly or something but he informed us these Ecover Tablets are mostly to blame for the bad odor. He highly recommended only using a teaspoon of liquid dishwasher soap like Cascade. So guess we won’t be buying these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: jaxon814

customer_reviews.title: These wash dishes well and they say they are friendlier to environment
customer_reviews.text: It was nice to be able to order them rather than run to the store before the holidays. This is a good product, I have used it for a long time without problems. The plastic wrap needs to be opened before putting it to a dishwashing machine. It would be even nicer if there is an eco friendly material that can be left in place to melt when the washing starts.
customer_reviews.author: innovator

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Ecover Fragrance free tablets!
customer_reviews.text: Previously i was purchasing the "Ecover Fragrance free" dishwasher tablets and I was not very satisfied with the results. The water is very hard in my place and after every dishwashing cycle, i saw white hard water stains on the vessels. Hence I tried changing to these Citrus tablets and I was really happy to see the results. Though the water is still hard, i did not see much stains on the vessels after each wash. I wash using the normal cycle and did not do heated dry. The dishes are coming out clean and good than the previous one. Thanks to the product. I will keep buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rag

customer_reviews.title: individually wrapped!
customer_reviews.text: My fault, I should have looked more closely! Not only is each one INDIVIDUALLY WRAPPED <arrrrrrghhhh> the wrappers are in useless plastic bits that don't actually get rescycled (anything that's higher than1 or 2 these days are really not being recycled, even if your recycling "takes" them... China won't accept them anymore, and it's rippling back thru the recycle world. Anyway, am very disappointed, won't order again. I'm sure they work fine, but I DO NOT WANT TO UNWRAP EACH ONE BEFORE USING IT! Too easy to forget.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Good option
customer_reviews.text: Decided to give these a try even after reading the reviews. We were using Cascade but switched to these. While they do come wrapped in plastic which defeats the purpose of being better for the environment, we actually quite like using these. The scent is nice but not overpowering. Other reviews talked about residue, we have not had that problem and have used two full boxes. Would recommend these, especially if you are looking for better environmental options.
customer_reviews.author: Amberlina

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic waste
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that this "eco" product comes in individually wrapped plastic! It's not too recyclable if it's that small.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have never written an unsolicited review but just had to do this one. What a difference in my dishes & silverware. Even the stainless steel dishwasher interior looked cleaner. I will definitely use this product all the time. It is everything the previous reviewers who gave it 4-5 stars. So what if you have to tear open a cellophane wrap! You do it to eat a candy bar!
customer_reviews.author: Punkie

customer_reviews.title: Works incredibly well, just don't like the individual plastic wrappers
customer_reviews.text: These work incredibly well for a natural dish detergent without all the harsh chemicals. My only qualm is that each tablet is wrapped in plastic - super unnecessary and not eco friendly at all hence the 4 stars. I have started buying the powder instead to keep things more environmentally friendly. If they get rid of the plastic wrappers I would happily switch back to these tablets because they're more convenient and work really well and then these would be 5 stars no problem. I'd also highly recommend their same brand of dishwasher rinse aid, combined they give you a perfect clean.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Z

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing-love these.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I used this product for the first time and used only half of a tablet in the first wash. It worked beautifully. No tacky feel on dishes at all. They were sparkling and very clean. I like them better than the Finish or Cascade tablets. I do have a water softener, I don’t know if that made a difference with my dishes coming out amazing and other reviewers struggling with a film on theirs. I would highly recommend these tablets. I will forever be purchasing them!
customer_reviews.author: Brinkley

customer_reviews.title: Work great... but pretty sure the tablets are wrapped in plastic....
customer_reviews.text: 1st things 1st-- these work great. I'm just not sure they're as eco-friendly as they claim to be because each tablet is wrapped individually in plastic. Now, it could be made of corn, but if that were the case I don't think I'd have to remove the tablet from the wrapping before putting it in the dishwasher (which you definitely do, I tried leaving it on and it did not dissolve). Outside of that, I'm very pleased with this product and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cltucker916

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Great! Packaging Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I had been using another green cleaner for a couple years but never felt it did the best job. Also it was rather expensive. I decided to try this product since it was less expensive. I am so impressed by its cleaning power. It takes the coffee and tea stains out of my cups like magic and the glasses are spotless. My only complaint about this product is the packaging. The cardboard box is very recyclable but the individual plastic wraps are not. I am hoping the manufacturer will take that into account and modify the packaging at some point. Otherwise I really like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but if your trying to be environmentally conscious rethink your purchase
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works well and I like the scent. It’s appears to clean better than an eco-friendly liquid, that I had from a different brand. But I hate the single plastic wrapping. It comes in a cardboard box which is nice but the single wrapping is unnecessary. I Can’t find the stamp that shows if they test on animals. So I have assume they do...?! Which there would be more transparency.
customer_reviews.author: Ines Russell-Tuerk

customer_reviews.title: No residue, dissolved, half tablet
customer_reviews.text: Used for the first time in an old dish washer. I read they might not dissolve well and you only need half a tablet. So, I did half a tablet in the cutlery tray instead of the soap dispenser. Dishes came out clean (some had dried up yogurt on them), no soap residue noticed, and tablet dissolved in tray. Soap did not get fresh tea stains out of a mug. Overall happy with the product. If I have issues, I will post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Ponyo

customer_reviews.title: What's the benefit, really?
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work fine. Not too happy about the individually wrapped in plastic tablets. They market them as "recyclable wrappers" which yeah, they are. But it's still waste. Plastic still has to be made and not everyone recylcles. So that's more waste from a product I bought to be more environmentally responsible. Why not have the kind that dissolve in water? No waste at all. So it's either chemicals and no waste with another product or less chemicals and more waste with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Duckie

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly? But works well.
customer_reviews.text: I received these yesterday and have used them once so far. I chose them for the price and the eco-friendliness. Right away I was disappointed by these because while they are supposedly eco-friendly, each pod is individually wrapped!! How disappointing to waste so much plastic, especially in a “green” product. However, I was happy with how the product worked in my dishwasher, no complaints here! So while I was very disappointed in the wasteful packaging, I so far like the product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't clean anymore.  What has changed?
customer_reviews.text: Unsure what has changed but doesn't clean dishes at all even with a brand new high end dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: McT

customer_reviews.title: They do a good job for us!
customer_reviews.text: Works much better in my dishwasher than seventh generation pods did. I have very hard water and much prefer these pods I continue to purchase Ecover pods again and again after 2 plus years of use. Perhaps there are better products out there However, I am happy. Use with a rinse aid is nice, if you have hard water. However, it is not necessary. 7th generation HAD to have a rinse aid with our hard water.
customer_reviews.author: GloriaJoy

customer_reviews.title: works really well
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts on this item. Purchased one pack to try it in my new dishwasher. We have really hard water. At the beginning of the cycle, I put one tablet in the dispenser and put about half a cup of vinegar in the bottom of the dishwasher. My dishes come out sparkling clean. The glasses are so pretty and clear. No residue in my dishwasher. I have now set this item up as a subscribe item so I do not run out. For the record, I use vinegar in the rinse agent container also.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gutman

customer_reviews.title: These are the best dish tabs that I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Very clean & shiny dishwashing -- I especially love how my glasses and pyrex oven dishes come out totally free of cloudiness and milky streaks. The tablets are individually wrapped in high quality plastic, and I have not yet encountered a single tab that has been broken or even chipped. (I'm on my 3rd box now.) I do not have any chalky/cakey residue on my fingers after handling the tablet, nor is there a toxic smell.
customer_reviews.author: fgal

customer_reviews.title: Good Soap, Not So Good Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand a lot for being B Corp certified, cruelty free, clean energy manufactured and relatively affordable compared to similar products. It does the job fine, especially when I'm also using a rinse product. The tabs in this product come individually wrapped, which is annoying, and may be hard on frail hands. The website says they feel this is more environmentally friendly than the dissolving covers other tabs use. I don't know enough to judge that statement, but probably the plain powder product is the safest option for now.
customer_reviews.author: Briana la Fea

customer_reviews.title: Each individual tablet is covered in plastic
customer_reviews.text: These eco-friendly dishwasher soap tablets come with individual plastic packing for each tablet!!!! WHY??
customer_reviews.author: Puppy Puri

customer_reviews.title: Although I'm very happy with the way this product cleans
customer_reviews.text: Although I'm very happy with the way this product cleans, I am not buying again because each tablet is individually wrapped in plastic. Not so eco-friendly after all.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Every tablet is wrapped in plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to find this product. I've been working really hard to change my home to sustainable zero waste. Imagine my surprise and frustration to open this box and find each tablet wrapped in plastic!! There is no where in the description or label on the box to let me know this. I don't care if they say the plastic is recyclable. They are missing the point! I am not in manufacturing so I don't know what the solution is but can't they use a plant based packaging that is compostable? This was very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Noble

customer_reviews.title: The Quest for An Ecologically Sound Product Continues
customer_reviews.text: It works so much better than the Eco Nuts I was using that started out working well but deteriorated in quality. This product makes my glasses shine and cleans the dishes immaculately. Unfortunately, EWG shows Ecover as having two different kinds and one of them has carcinogens. Not wanting to have a cancer in a few years from my dishwasher soap, no matter how sparkly the glasses, I will go to the green, A rated, cruelty free Nature Clean Automatic Dishwasher Pacs that many reviewers said never leaves a powdery residue. It is expensive, but will be worth it hopefully. The quest for an ecologically sound product that works well continues.
customer_reviews.author: Observer One

customer_reviews.title: I buy these because the chemical kind make your glasses ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy these because the chemical kind make your glasses shiny because they are leaving a toxic film behind for your family to ingest. I find these work almost as well as the others. You can tell the lack of toxins when you open the machine to add a glass or whatever, as you don't gasp as the chemicals hit your lungs. I wait for these to be on sale here or elsewhere and buy bulk. Think about it, this is worth it. You, your family and pets are breathing chemicals every day with the other ones. These get your dishes just as shiny as long as you use a rinse agent. This company sells a rinse agent also.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Raine

customer_reviews.title: Dishwasher and dishes smell dirty after wash
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get more green however this product simply doesn't work well for me. I have well water and was using finish brand soap and rinse aid with great results. After washing with Ecover products instead my dishwasher has that sort of wet dog smell after a wash cycle with heat dry. I then have to run wash again with bowl of vinegar. Ugh. Have decent habits...I deep clean my machine often, rinse dishes well. And my machine is only 2 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: A good product made with good ingredients for a good price! Much safer than many popular brand name products or target brand dishwasher pods I used to use. We have had zero issues with these for years, we keep ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite powder tabs I ever used
customer_reviews.text: This tab is powerful. I would buy it again. Watch your cheaper cups with words on them for this soap could take the words off...that is how powerful it is. I loved it though for my regular dishes and pots and pans. Cleaned my roasting pan that was a true mess like nothing and turned it into looking brand new. Gets rid of grease...sauces..cleans everything...!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Burd

customer_reviews.title: Works great but individually packaged in plastic
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: i like the product so Ive purchased again but I hope the company will work towards making more sustainable wrappers or eliminate the wrappers all together. Original: Works well and smells nice but I was disappointed that they were individually packaged in plastic. That seems highly unnecessary especially for an eco friendly product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Plastic everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this with saying these do the job, and do it well. My main complaint is that, for being marketed as a eco brand, these are not very eco friendly. Every single pod is plastic wrapped. I was more than disappointed to see this, and yes, I know it’s so they do not melt together/dissolve if wet... but I feel like there has to be a better solution. Will look for a less plastic consuming alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Not Eco
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly eco when individual blocks are packaged in plastic and it is ver difficult to open each one! Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: TKEGG

customer_reviews.title: No fragrance, and the dishes are clean!
customer_reviews.text: Top considerations when buying dishwasher detergent: does it clean my dishes, and does it leave a fragrance behind? This one passed both tests--the dishes are clean, and they don't smell at all. The tablets are wrapped in plastic, which is a little annoying to unwrap, but not extremely so. The plastic wrapping has a recycling code, so you can take it to any store that accepts plastic bags. I just wish these were less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Meko

customer_reviews.title: No scent, no complaints, no residue
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous to try this because I haven't had a good experience with most eco friendly products but I was really happy with this product. It doesn't have any scent. It doesn't leave a residue on dishes. You ARE supposed to take the wrapper off- it is not a water soluble wrapper as my husband thought haha. It came in a simple cardboard box. Definitely will be subscribing monthly to these.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Clearly it's generating enough suds to do the job and it's nice to know it's doing with without all the chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Kenmore dishwasher that was installed prior to moving in. At this stage it's probably over 20 years old. I barely use my dishwasher and when I do, I'm not a fan of using the detergents with tons of harsh chemicals. I'm thoroughly impressed with how clean the Ecover tablets leave all the pots, pans, and dishes. Clearly it's generating enough suds to do the job and it's nice to know it's doing with without all the chemicals. Also leaves everything smelling "clean" without any of those synthetic fragrances.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Greenwashing!
customer_reviews.text: If you, like me, switched to this brand from a more well known brand in an effort to reduce the amount of plastic waste your family produces then you will be very disappointed. I opened the cardboard box to be surprised by individually plastic wrapped pods. I haven’t even tried these pods yet, but I won’t be purchasing again. The “eco” in your brand name is pure greenwashing.
customer_reviews.author: meggyme

customer_reviews.title: Beware of packaging
customer_reviews.text: Beware of packaging. I purchased this product in an attempt to reduce waste and avoid plastic. Inside the box, each individual tablet is wrapped in "recyclable" plastic. The USA does not have viable recycling programs to process plastics. The wrapping is unnecessary and undermines consumer trust in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: JBird

customer_reviews.title: Worked better for me than leading national brand.
customer_reviews.text: My dishes have never been shinier and the tablet is not leaving behind a disgusting residue like another big name brand that I had been using that had a little red ball embedded in it. This one, combined with the Ecover rinse aid is keeping my dishwasher clean and my dishes are coming out clean with very little pre-scrubbing. Very satisfied. I will definitely be buying this again. We have well water with a whole house filter but no softener. You might get different results with soft water.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Hardworking  scent-free product
customer_reviews.text: Cleans dishes super well without lingering odor or taste. Do note that the tablets come in individual plastic bags, which need to be removed before placing in dishwasher. Hubby made that mistake and those little bags are definitively waterproof! The little bags are just difficult enough that a small child would have some difficulty opening them, which I think is a plus. The price is a bit high, but the product is great, especially for those with allergies and sensitivities.
customer_reviews.author: Babba

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped in Plastic - Defeated the Purpose for Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these trying for a more environmentally friendly dishwasher tablet. They do clean my dishes and I have no complaints that way. BUT the individually wrapping of each tablet defeated the purpose for me. The wrappers are supposedly recyclable, but putting these tiny wrappers in my recycle bin doesn't work. I will be looking for another alternative with less waste.
customer_reviews.author: TLM

customer_reviews.title: Product works like a 5, but the individual plastic wrappers knocked it down a star.
customer_reviews.text: Love that this product cleans my dishes well, and doesn't leave behind the taste or smell of soap that other dishwasher tablets I've used have done. I like that Ecover cleaning products avoid using ingredients that are harmful to people and the planet. I would love to see them change the single-user plastic wrapper on these tablets to something like a disolving cellulose-based wrapper. This would increase the ease of use, while also eliminating those tiny little plastic wrappers that have to be removed and thrown in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: These really work awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Im so happy I have finally found a safer option for dishwasher pods that actually work! I am extremely happy with these. Ive been using them for 6 months now and I have never had an issue. They clean my dishes very well, every time and do not clog up my dishwasher! I HIGHLY recommend these to anyone wanting to get away from toxic dishwasher pods!
customer_reviews.author: Sara W.

customer_reviews.title: Last resort is now my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I got these during the initial COVID-19 panic when everything was sold out. They were a last resort buy and I am so glad I got them. They work really well for half the price of the other brands. They are scent free and clean well without leaving a residue. My only complaint is like many others -I don’t love that they are individually wrapped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning with these!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Seventh Generation dishwasher powder for years. Tried these out on a whim and actually have been much happier with these. Seventh Generation powder would often leave residue and sometimes not clean that well. I have not seen any of that with Ecover - never residue and always clean dishes come out. I get these on sub and save with Amazon monthly now, great deal and will continue to use these. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Treenz

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: We had no idea how bad our old dishwashing detergent was until we used this. It got stains easily off of coffee mugs that we have been scrubbing and scrubbing without success! It also didn't leave behind a residue. This was an accidental purchase - something I grabbed quickly because of Covid-19, and now we won't go back!
customer_reviews.author: A. King

customer_reviews.title: Wrapped in Plastic.. Hmm.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Ecover dishwasher tabs before and they had a biodegradable packaging around the tabs (not sure how great that is for the environment either) but these have (recyclable) wrappers around each tab. Which just feels silly. I'll buy a powdered detergent next time. Overall, I like how Ecover tabs work in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Like most eco-friendly dishwashing detergents I have tried it leaves ...
customer_reviews.text: The Ecover tablets were an OK product for the dishwasher, but it won't get out the toughest spots. It removes most food, but if the food is really dried out it won't work. Like most eco-friendly dishwashing detergents I have tried it leaves sometimes a dust of powder on your dishes (although not the amount the 7th Generation leaves behind). It leaves some spots on plastic containers, but not as much as other similar products. Even the citrus one does not leave flagrance on the dishes. The tablets are individually packed. I really wanted this one to work, the kitchen being the place were I really want to go with eco-friendly products all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ana MariaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the plastic an we would be cool bro
customer_reviews.text: I removed one star cause they come individually wrapped in plastic. It’s not hard to stack them up an have them wrapped in paper. They work. There eco friendly. I enjoy knowing there don’t chemicals anywhere. Just wish they did not come in plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. Works great if I wash dishes first, not rinse, wash. I do have a brand new dishwasher as well. However if the dishwasher loads are light washes, it works well, no residue, no scent which I like, and a square tab fits in the square slot. Not a waste of money, and if on a budget, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: EssentiallyBlonde

customer_reviews.title: Great dishwasher cleaning results! cl
customer_reviews.text: Noticible improvement over other dw tablets. Great value for quality of product. With Ecover, I do not have to wash the dishes & silverware BEFORE loading the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: CHLOE RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Get the Zero variety!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in concert with the Ecover Rinse Aid and I love both. Both the are zero formulation and are fragrance free, which is what I need. I would have subscribed and bought more of these, but they jacked up the price and so I will wait until the price goes back down to purchase again. They should be $5 something not $7! Don't rip me off just because I'm trying to go green... us health conscious folks tend to be pretty educated as well, so don't get taken!
customer_reviews.author: In-the-anomaly

customer_reviews.title: No stink, no streak, no residues!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product and great value for your money. We have been using this for several months now on a consistent and regular basis. We have tried many other products in the past and by far this dishwasher detergent outshines them all. Cleans glasses well without leaving any streaks and does not leave any residues or orders behind.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Diep

customer_reviews.title: No fancy packaging, just a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried most every dishwasher tab on the market. Most do a good job, most of the time. I've been using Ecover for several months now. It is the only tab I've used that consistently gets everything clean, even baked on food like lasagna or mac and cheese. I've not had to re-wash a single item. Ecover also leaves the inside of the dishwasher with a nice clean scent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: They work, just ok. I notice spots since I’ve started this brand. Extra plastic waste having a wrapper on tablet but also glad it is not being disintegrated in my dishes like the liquid packets. Overall they are washing ok, the ingredients are kind of vague. I was looking for something with no chemicals. My box personally arrived all bent up. So I put them in a bag, I gave them 3/5 stars. They was ok, but despite rinse aide, I noticed more spots worth this brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Rain

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: The dishes retain the citrus fragrance, which I do not like. Also these are individually wrapped in plastic which is not environment friendly at all. Some of tablets was already in powdered state even before unwrapping and few others left traces on the powder in the dishwasher. I would prefer the Ecover Soap tablets without any fragrance over this one.
customer_reviews.author: SGR

customer_reviews.title: Each pod is wrapped in single use plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews. I was trying to find a detergent that would be gentle on the environment. Imagine my surprise when inside the cardboard eco container is 45 individually plastic wrapped pods! Ugh. The search continues
customer_reviews.author: home gardener 22

customer_reviews.title: Tablets are great, even for hard water
customer_reviews.text: Zero Tablets are great. Bought Zero powder to save $. I don't know why powder doesn't work. I've tried barely using any and using a lot. Glasses covered in white and plates dirty. I've even run loads twice and everything is still dirty. We have really hard water in N Dallas and have never found any "somewhat safe" dishwashing detergent to work. But tried the Zero tablets because they are not expensive. They work great and I like that it's a healthy alternative to other brands. Will Keep using tablets but not powder.
customer_reviews.author: TexasKel

customer_reviews.title: Lip service to the environment
customer_reviews.text: They work fine for cleaning dishes. As good as any other brand I've used. The thing is, you pay a premium on these to supposedly be better for the environment. So I was very surprised and amused to find that when you open the recycled cardboard box, each individual detergent pod is individually wrapped in plastic. I've never seen that in any other brand, even the ones like Finish that don't claim to give a hoot about the planet. This stuff is the Blue Apron of dishwasher detergent. Way too much packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: The BOMB.
customer_reviews.text: I buy this over and over – it’s the only dishwasher detergent we will use. It doesn’t release toxic fumes and it does such a beautiful job cleaning. zero complaints after two years of using.
customer_reviews.author: NOIR13

customer_reviews.title: Gets Dishes Shiny Clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled to have found this dishwasher product. My dishes come out clean and sparkly every time. I had been using Seventh Generation but was unhappy with the results, or perhaps I should say lack of results. Ecover Zero Fragrance is awesome. I have a parrot and feel very safe using this product around him. Oh and another really great thing - it only takes half a tablet to do a normal load of dishes! I simply cut them in half and store the unused half in a Ziplock.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Love this. My dishes sparkle (and I do not ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My dishes sparkle (and I do not use jet dry!), my dishes don’t taste like that horrible “cascade” taste. My house doesn’t smell terrible when my dishwasher is on. Love it. Don’t love the opening of the packages, with slippery hands from loading it’s a challenge. Wish they didn’t come individually wrapped in plastic. Or maybe with that dissolving cornstarch type layer. But I’ll buy them anyway. For all the orher reasons!! Can’t stand to drink/eat at friends that use other stuff.... nasty. I give this stuff away constantly!! Convert folks.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Twinmom

customer_reviews.title: Cleans with no residue
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with how well these work. No residue or funky smell on the dishes after washing, like I've experienced with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie

product_meta.title: Ecover Automatic Dishwashing Tablets Zero, 25 Count, 17.6 Ounce
product_meta.description: Scent Name:Unscented| Size:25 Count (Pack of 1)Power away stubborn, stuck on food with these easy to use automatic dishwasher tablets. Made with plant based & mineral ingredients, our biodegradable, phosphate free formula effectively washes your dirty dishes, glasses and flatware without harming the planet. Now that's what we call clean.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
